title.native: 覇王大系リューナイト アデュー・レジェンド
title.romaji: Haou Taikei Ryuu Knight: Adeu Legend
title.english: Lord of Lords Ryu Knight: Adeu's Legend

description:
In an old world clash between light and darkness (as always), the evil Lord Uongadis is sealed away under a gigantic monument called the Earth Blade. 20 years have passed since the wars, and now the threat of evil being brought back is greater than ever as demons try to revive their lord.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Lord of Lords Adeu's Legend OVA

title.native: 覇王大系リューナイト アデュー・レジェンドⅡ
覇王大系リューナイト

name.native: アデュー・ウォルサム

node.description:
[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BC%8A%E6%9D%B1%E5%B2%B3%E5%BD%A6) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takehiko_It%C5%8D)

Takehiko Itou, born in Kitami, Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan, is an illustrator and mangaka best known for his work on [Outlaw Star](https://anilist.co/anime/400/). He was also the primary creative mind behind [Angel Links](https://anilist.co/anime/1226/), the [Future Retro Hero Story](https://anilist.co/manga/33718/) manga, and other works of fiction set in the Toward Stars universe. He also developed the original concept for [NG Knight Ramune & 40](https://anilist.co/anime/2084/).

(Source: Anidb)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BC%8A%E6%9D%B1%E5%B2%B3%E5%BD%A6) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takehiko_It%C5%8D)

Takehiko Itou, born in Kitami, Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan, is an illustrator and mangaka best known for his work on [Outlaw Star](https://anilist.co/anime/400/). He was also the primary creative mind behind [Angel Links](https://anilist.co/anime/1226/), the [Future Retro Hero Story](https://anilist.co/manga/33718/) manga, and other works of fiction set in the Toward Stars universe. He also developed the original concept for [NG Knight Ramune & 40](https://anilist.co/anime/2084/).

(Source: Anidb)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/土器手司)

A veteran animator best known for his involvement in the [Dirty Pair](https://anilist.co/anime/424/) franchise during the '80s, as well as the adaptations of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/)'s works. His skills were first recognized by [Yasuhiko Yoshikazu](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/) during the production of [Giant Gorg](https://anilist.co/anime/3327/), who then put him in charge of supervising three of the episodes. He has been involved with numerous of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s production's ever since.

[Website](https://or-lab.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/k1oku)

Graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.
